TOC $ Mr© Flagg hurried us past the other groups that were forming
for the parade$ the Mechanics Benfit Society* 'the Carpenter
Architectural and Benevolent Association# the Association of
Carmen* all in snow white frocks* tied at the neck and waist
with green ribbons.? I could not help reflecting# as we
walked along how unlike France this country had become© All
around* we saw changes all around we saw the evidences of
equality* even the absence of central power and yet at the
same time* we saw stability such as to do not enjoy in France©
The American Revolution produced a Y«ashingto»# not a Napoleon©
It had no reign of Terror* and General Washington was followed
not by counter-revolutions! and plots within plots# but by
an orderly succession of constitutional presidents© How strange#
I thought# ar© the affairs of men that on one side of the
Atlantic* there is pessimism and gloom! and on the other
optimism;, and confidence© Whether pessimism* or optimism was
the right choice lies# of course in th® hands of time5 and of
the people of the earth© Such were my thoughts# as we reached
the place where an old gentleman was sunning himself beside
his carriage# waiting for the procession to start©
